cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterfly species determine variation in the size, shape, and color of eggs.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Butterfly Life Cycle Organisms and Host Plants

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: egg size, shape, and color depend on the species
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Traits affected: size, shape, color of eggs

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The time metamorphosis takes varies according to the butterfly species.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Butterfly Life Cycle Organisms and Host Plants

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: anywhere from a few days to several weeks

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject biological taxon determines specific phenotypic traits (e.g., size, shape, color) of the object life stage or structure.
args.justification: The description states that egg size, shape, and color depend on the butterfly species; this is a directional causal determination from species to egg traits, so a predicate expressing trait determination is appropriate.

args.canonical_rel_desc: The temporal duration of the subject process varies as a function of the object factor (e.g., species).
args.justification: The text explicitly says the time metamorphosis takes varies according to the butterfly species, which is a dependency of process duration on species; a predicate capturing duration dependence fits best.

Both relations describe biological properties (egg traits, metamorphosis duration) that systematically depend on or are determined by butterfly species, so they belong to the same family of dependency/causal relations.
In both cases the object (species) is a causal or determining factor for a property of the subject (traits, duration), matching a causal/dependency dimension rather than mere association.
